page.title: 03HOTHORPE HALL THEDDINGWORTH
page.content: The site of the old village of Hothorpe is in front of Hothorpe Hall. The road to Hothorpe started from the west end of Theddingworth. Old houses and the road were dismantled early in the 19th century to improve the landscaping of the Hall and replaced by the present road and Pebble Cottages. The attics of these cottages were used for the weaving of plush for silk hats. All that remains of Hothorpe village now is the main Hall, with its own Chapel. Until recently it was a Lutheran Centre but now it is run by an Anglican group as a conference centre
